#summary This page describes a way to setup OpenVolunteer by using a django project sample and a automatic install-script.
#labels Featured,Phase-Deploy
#sidebar Quick install

= Requirements =
You need:
 * Python 2.5 installed on current host
 * Python Imaging Library (1.1.6 recommended)
 * Django 1.1 installed on current host
 * An access to a database engine (MySQL server for example)

= Install it =
 # Get the last tarball of [http://openvolunteer.googlecode.com/files/quick_DjangoProject_setup.tar.gz quick_DjangoProject_setup]
 # Extract the content of this tarball by:
{{{ 
tar -xzf quick_DjangoProject_setup.tar.gz 
}}}
 # Go to new `ovdemo/` folder and run install script:
{{{
cd ovdemo
chmod +x ov_install.sh 
./ov_install.sh
}}}   
 # Configure the database settings in `settings.py` file:
{{{
DATABASE_ENGINE = ''
DATABASE_NAME = ''
DATABASE_USER = ''
DATABASE_PASSWORD = ''
DATABASE_HOST = ''
DATABASE_PORT = ''
}}}
 # run the both command to synchronize database and run a test server:
{{{
python manage.py syncdb
python manage.py runserver
}}}
 # access to http://127.0.0.1:8000
